A minimal example

Yizeng Li

2025-05-04

Source: vignettes/home.Rmd
home.Rmd

Introduction

This short vignette demonstrates fitting a Likelihood-based Additive Single-Effect (LARSE) model using the glmcs pacakge. We simulate a sparse linear regression problem, fit with up to LL single-effect compoenetns, and visualize the results.

Simulate data 

set.seed(42)

n <- 1000    # sample size
p <- 1000    # number of predictors
L <- 10      # number of single-effect components

theta_true <- rep(0, p)
theta_true[c(1, 2, 300, 400)] <- 1

X <- matrix(rnorm(n * p), nrow = n, ncol = p)
y <- drop(X %*% theta_true + rnorm(n, sd = 1.5))

Fit the LASER model 

library(glmcs)
res <- glmcs(
  X              = X,
  y              = y,
  L              = L,
  family         = gaussian()
)

Results
